data.title: Book Review : Digital Fortress by Dan Brown
data.meta_description: It's about a code(digital fortress) that can't be decrypted even by NSA's super computer TRANSLTR. TRANSLTR encounters a code that seems to be unbreakable. So to get help with the code, commander Strathmore calls Susan Fletcher, the head cryptographer. The code is written by Ensei Tankado, a former NSA's employee.On the other hand, Susan's fiance,…
data.text:
It’s about a code(digital fortress) that can’t be decrypted even by NSA’s super computer TRANSLTR. TRANSLTR encounters a code that seems to be unbreakable. So to get help with the code, commander Strathmore calls Susan Fletcher, the head cryptographer. The code is written by Ensei Tankado, a former NSA’s employee.

On the other hand, Susan’s fiance, David Becker has gone to Seville to recover a ring that is suspected to have the code to unlock digital fortress. There he is followed by an assassin, who is in search for the passcode. Thus, harmlessly recovering a ring became a chase of life and death for him.

It is a mystery, thriller book.

Dan brown teleports you to the world of cryptography and code breaking. I was a stranger to cryptography but it written so nicely that I understood it easily. The story is all done in around 24 hours. Dan Brown has written the book so complicated that it took around 500 pages to tell a story of a just twenty four hour time span. It is a book that will make you to read more and more. You wouldn’t be able to put it down until the last page, an absolute page turner.

Who will guard the guards?

Ensei Tankado

It is said that in death, all things became clear.

Dan Brown

You can’t jump for stars if your feet hurt.

Dan Brown

there’s always others options.

Dan Brown

Rating : 4/5

You will want to read it until the last page

RECOMMENDED!!!
